channel.title: Please help.. not updating?
channel.description: Okay i almost have my rsps ready to release and im trying to find a way to make it to where i can auto update my rsps ingame so people don't have to keep redownloading the server i believe it's already coded but it's not exactly working for some reason here is a picture of the (command)

item.title: Please help.. not updating?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Lil_Smok3r:

No, if he removes a file, I’m not sure if you can get it back, but if he makes a mistake in the file, you can go back to previous versions

If he removes a file and you’re the owner of the folder, you do get an option to “restore” the file. Hell, I get that option when I removed files on purpose/accident and I’m not even in a shared folder.

Read full topic

item.title: Please help.. not updating?
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

Lil_Smok3r:

Haha, right click the file, and click view previous versions, and then choose the version you want, and click restore. Problem solved

haha, thanks man. 1 more question tho :palm: im trying to get it to where people are able to just hop right on the server when they download it instead of manually putting the cache into the C: drive? I’ve looked up guides on auto cache downloaders but what iv’e seen so far the guy who made this client/source already has it set to do that but it’s not working.

Read full topic

item.title: Please help.. not updating?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Haha, right click the file, and click view previous versions, and then choose the version you want, and click restore. Problem solved

Read full topic

item.title: Please help.. not updating?
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“Lil_Smok3r, post:6, topic:545940”]Using Dropbox?
Dropbox allows you both to share the source, whilst at the same time, if he makes a change, it changes for you too. It’s a good program And if you make any mistakes, you can go back to the previous versions of the file.[/quote]

So pretty much i’ll give him the updated version atm, and then when he updates whatever he just sends the files to me of what he has done, and if anything goes wrong…say he accidentally removes something ill still have the source of mine to go back on? i believe i got what ur saying thanks so much for all the help i may pm you a time or 2 for a little more lol. sorry for all ur time.

Read full topic

item.title: Please help.. not updating?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Using Dropbox?
Dropbox allows you both to share the source, whilst at the same time, if he makes a change, it changes for you too. It’s a good program And if you make any mistakes, you can go back to the previous versions of the file.

Read full topic

item.title: Please help.. not updating?
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:4, topic:545940”][quote author=tank nation link=topic=664830.msg4444290#msg4444290 date=1407992775]

They will never have to redownload anything if you are applying patches to the server, this command initiates the update timer, when it hits 0 the server will safely disconnect the world.

Now, if it is not working may I ask if your in-game username is “Defence” and are you of the rank “owner” if not I am pretty sure that is why you cannot perform the command.

Also another thing I noticed, where you have [tt]PlayerHandler.updateSeconds = 90;[/tt] the ‘90’ should be the letter ‘a’ so you are able to specify a specific time limit before the server restarts rather than 90 seconds.

Okay thank you, and what do u mean by adding patches? So i can pretty much add anything into the game do ::update and people should be able to see new content into the game? For example if i added chaos altar to the rsps they could see that after? Or if i wanted to move it from one spot to another they would be able to see it? correct me if im wrong just learning.
[/quote]

Yes that’s correct.[/quote]

Okay one more question please? My friend is helping me do the server and when he updates something it don’t go into my source ofc so how would he send it to me or whatever so i can add to game.

Read full topic

item.title: Please help.. not updating?
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[quote=“tank nation, post:3, topic:545940”][quote author=AtomicInt_ link=topic=664830.msg4444283#msg4444283 date=1407990631]
They will never have to redownload anything if you are applying patches to the server, this command initiates the update timer, when it hits 0 the server will safely disconnect the world.

Now, if it is not working may I ask if your in-game username is “Defence” and are you of the rank “owner” if not I am pretty sure that is why you cannot perform the command.

Also another thing I noticed, where you have [tt]PlayerHandler.updateSeconds = 90;[/tt] the ‘90’ should be the letter ‘a’ so you are able to specify a specific time limit before the server restarts rather than 90 seconds.
[/quote]

Okay thank you, and what do u mean by adding patches? So i can pretty much add anything into the game do ::update and people should be able to see new content into the game? For example if i added chaos altar to the rsps they could see that after? Or if i wanted to move it from one spot to another they would be able to see it? correct me if im wrong just learning.[/quote]

Yes that’s correct.

Read full topic

They will never have to redownload anything if you are applying patches to the server, this command initiates the update timer, when it hits 0 the server will safely disconnect the world.

Now, if it is not working may I ask if your in-game username is “Defence” and are you of the rank “owner” if not I am pretty sure that is why you cannot perform the command.

Also another thing I noticed, where you have [tt]PlayerHandler.updateSeconds = 90;[/tt] the ‘90’ should be the letter ‘a’ so you are able to specify a specific time limit before the server restarts rather than 90 seconds.
